_header: As I walked upon a day / To take the air of field & flower
Note:
Ringler Jr. (1992)
XRingler Jr., William A. Bibliography and Index of English Verse in Manuscript 1501-1558. London: Mansell, 1992; prepared and completed by Michael Rudick and Susan J. Ringler .
Subjects: contemporary conditions; sins, deadly; chansons d’aventure
_description: Give me License to live in Ease — eleven 12-line stanzas with refrain phrase ‘to lyue in ease.’

CULFf16.First Lines:
As I walkyd a pon a dayTo take the eyre of fylde &
                    floureApon a mylde mornyng of mayWhen floures ben full of swete
                    savoure…
CULFf16.Last Lines:
…In that worthy blys that we may dwellAnd gyff vs all lysens
                    to lyve in ease
CULFf16.Attributed Title:
Explicit in veritate Da michi quod merui (f.
                    58v)
CULFf16.Facsimiles:
Beadle,  Richard,  and  Alfred E. B. Owen.  
             The Findern Manuscript: Cambridge University Library MS. F.1.6.
         London: Scolar Press, 1977.

Halliwell-Phillipps,  James Orchard. 
             Nugae Poeticae: Select Pieces of Old English Popular Poetry,
                Illustrating the Manners and Arts of the Fifteenth Century.
         London: J. R. Smith, 1844: 64-7.
Furnivall,  Frederick James,
                        ed.  
             Political, Religious and Love Poems, from Lambeth MS. 306 and other
                sources.
EETS
         o.s. 15 (1866); repr. 1962; rev. ed. 1903: 244-8.

HunHM183.First Lines:
As I walkyd vppon a dayTo take þe aere off feld and
                    flowre…
HunHM183.Last Lines:
…And withyn his gloryus blysse thatt we all may dwellAnd geve
                    vs there licence to lyve yn ese
HunHM183.Note: Written as prose; nineteenth-century transcript by Haslewood in London,  British Library Addit. 11307, f. 121.
HunHM183.Editions:
Brydges,  Sir Samuel Egerton. 
             Censura Literaria.
         10 vols. London: Longman, 1805-09; 2nd ed., 1815: 8.77-81.
Brown,  Carleton Fairchild,
                        ed.  
             Religious Lyrics of the XVth Century.
         Oxford: Clarendon, 1939: 273-7.
